sen.j: 俊堯（しゅんぎょう、元永元年（1118年）‐文治2年（1186年））は、平安時代末期の僧侶。
sen.e: Shungyo(1118-1186) was a Buddhist monk at the end of the Heian Period.
Shungyo(1118-1186) was a Buddhist monk at the end of the Heian Period.
Shungyo (1118 - 1186) was a Buddhist priest at the end of the Heian Period.
He was the 58th Chief Abbot of the Tendai sect.
He was the 58th Chief Abbot of the Tendai sect.
He was the 58th Chief Abbot of the Tendai sect.

sen.j: 源義仲の追従者で、明雲の死後に義仲に擁立されて天台座主となった人物。
sen.e: He was a follower of the Shogun Minamoto-no-Yoshinaka and following the death of the Abbot Myoun, he became Chief Abbot with the patronage of Yoshinaka.
He was a follower of the Shogun Minamoto-no-Yoshinaka and following the death of the Abbot Myoun, he became Chief Abbot with the patronage of Yoshinaka.
He was a follower of the Shogun MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka and following the death of the Abbot Myoun, he became Tendai-zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect) with the patronage of Yoshinaka.
sen.cmt: 人名表現を修正しました。天台座主 を追加しました。

sen.j: 神祇伯源顕仲の子として生まれ、俗名は源顕智といった。
sen.e: He was born to Minamoto-no-Akinaka who was head of the Jingi-kan (Department of Worship) and he was named Minamoto-no-kenchi.
He was born to Minamoto-no-Akinaka who was head of the Jingi-kan (Department of Worship) and he was named Minamoto-no-kenchi.
He was born to MINAMOTO no Akinaka who served as Jingi haku (a chief official in charge of matters relating to Shintoism) and he was named MINAMOTO no Kenchi.
sen.cmt: 人名、役職表現を修正しました。

sen.j: 比叡山東塔の五智院に住み込み、大僧都の相源や清高に師事した。
sen.e: He lived in the Gochi-in of the East Tower at Mt. Hiei and was taught by Senior High Priests Aigen and Seiko.
sen.cmt: 相源の読みが不明です。
sen.e: He lived in the Gochi-in of the East Tower at Mt. Hiei and was taught by Senior High Priests Aigen and Seiko.

He lived in the Gochi-in of the Todo district, Mt. Hiei and was taught by Sogen and Seiko who held the rank of Daisozu (the highest grade that can be held by one who has reached the second highest rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests)
sen.cmt: 地名、役職表現を修正しました。

sen.j: 永万元年（1165年）当時、「弁阿闍梨」と称されていた俊尭は、弟子の悪僧のことにより暗闇に乗じて山を下り、検非違使の家に向かうという事件があった(『顕広王記』8月23日条)。
sen.e: According to the Akihirooki (Diary of Akihiro-o), in 1165, Toshitaka who was called Ben-ajari (Buddhist priest), left the mountain after bad behaviour of one of his disciples and headed to the home of the Kebiishi (Japanese official) on 23rd of August.

According to the Akihirooki (Diary of Akihiro-o), in 1165, Toshitaka who was called Ben-ajari (Buddhist priest), left the mountain after bad behaviour of one of his disciples and headed to the home of the Kebiishi (Japanese official) on 23rd of August.

In 1165, there was an incident that Gyokei, who was called Ben-ajari (Buddhist priest), left the mountain after bad behavior of one of his disciples and headed to the home of the kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers) in the dark (according to the entry on October 6 of "Akihirooki" (The diary of the Prince Akihiro)).
sen.cmt: 役職表現を修正しました。翻訳を補足しました。

sen.j: 嘉応2年（1170年）法印となるが、これについて九条兼実は『玉葉』のなかで「世上不レ為レ可云々、併莫レ不レ驚二耳目一」との所管を書き、寿永元年（1182年）7月に更に僧正へと昇進する際には「奇異」とまで書いている。
sen.e: In 1170 he became a Hoin (highest rank of Priest), and Kujo Kanezane wrote in his diary called Gyokuyo '世上不レ為レ可云々、併莫レ不レ驚二耳目一' and when Shungyo was further promoted to Bishop he wrote his opinion that it was 'bizarre'.
sen.cmt: 所管ではなく、所感のことでしょう。 世上不レ為レ可云々、併莫レ不レ驚二耳目一 （意味不明）
sen.e: In 1170 he became a Hoin (highest rank of Priest), and Kujo Kanezane wrote in his diary called Gyokuyo '世上不レ為レ可云々、併莫レ不レ驚二耳目一' and when Shungyo was further promoted to Bishop he wrote his opinion that it was 'bizarre'.

In 1170 he became Hoin (highest rank of Priest), and Kanezane KUJO wrote in his diary called "Gyokuyo," '世上不レ為レ可云々、併莫レ不レ驚二耳目一' and when Shungyo was further promoted to sojo (a priest ranked in the highest managerial position) he wrote his opinion that it was 'bizarre.'
sen.cmt: 玉葉 の原文の意味が分かりませんでした。そのまま載せてあります。

sen.j: 源義仲入京後は義仲に接近した。
sen.e: He became close to Yoshinaka after Minamoto-no-Yoshinaka occupied Kyoto.
He became close to Yoshinaka after Minamoto-no-Yoshinaka occupied Kyoto.
He became close to MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka after he occupied Kyoto.

sen.j: 義仲は、みずからが奉じていた北陸宮（以仁王第一王子）を皇位につけようとこの俊堯に後白河法皇への取り成しを依頼した。
sen.e: Yoshinaka wished to enthrone Hokuriku-no-miya (first son of Prince Mochihito) and asked Shungyo to mediate with Emperor Go-Shirakawa
Yoshinaka wished to enthrone Hokuriku-no-miya (first son of Prince Mochihito) and asked Shungyo to mediate with Emperor Go-Shirakawa
Yoshinaka wished to enthrone Hokuriku no miya (first son of Prince Mochihito) whom he had served, and asked Shungyo to mediate with Emperor Goshirakawa.

sen.j: しかし後白河法皇からは完全に無視され、高倉天皇の皇子四之宮が後鳥羽天皇として即位した。
sen.e: However he was completely ignored by Emperor Go-Shirakawa and Emperor Takakura's son Shinomiya ascended to the throne under the name Emperor Go-Toba.
However he was completely ignored by Emperor Go-Shirakawa and Emperor Takakura's son Shinomiya ascended to the throne under the name Emperor Go-Toba.
However he was completely ignored by Emperor Goshirakawa and Emperor Takakura's son Shinomiya ascended to the throne under the name Emperor Gotoba.
sen.cmt: Goshirakawa, Gotoba に修正しました。

sen.j: しかし寿永2年（1183年）11月に義仲が後白河法皇のいる法住寺殿を襲撃し、クーデタをおこした。
sen.e: However in November 1183, Yoshinaka staged a coup, attacking Hojuji Temple while Emperor Go-Shirakawa was present.
However in November 1183, Yoshinaka staged a coup, attacking Hojuji Temple while Emperor Go-Shirakawa was present.
However in December 1183, Yoshinaka staged a coup, attacking Hoju-ji Temple while Emperor Goshirakawa was present.
sen.cmt: Goshirakawaに修正しました。グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: その際に法住寺殿に居合わせた天台座主明雲が殺害される。
sen.e: The Tendai Sect Chief Abbot Myoun, who was also present, was murdered during the attack.
The Tendai Sect Chief Abbot Myoun, who was also present, was murdered during the attack.
Myoun, who was Tendai-zasu and was also present, was murdered during the attack.
sen.cmt: 天台座主 を追加しました。

sen.j: この明雲に代わって天台座主になったのが俊堯だった。
sen.e: It was Shungyo who subsequently became Chief Abbot in place of Myoun.
It was Shungyo who subsequently became Chief Abbot in place of Myoun.
It was Shungyo who subsequently became Tendai-zasu in place of Myoun.
sen.cmt: 天台座主 を追加しました。

sen.j: この人事には義仲の意向があったことは言うまでもなく、『玉葉』には「与二義仲一為二親眤一」「木曽之定使」などと書かれている。
sen.e: It goes without saying that Yoshinaka had a say in this appointment, and in Gyokuyo (Kujo Kanezane's diary) it mentions that ''与二義仲一為二親眤一''木曽之定使'
sen.cmt: 「与二義仲一為二親眤一」「木曽之定使」（意味不明）
sen.e: It goes without saying that Yoshinaka had a say in this appointment, and in Gyokuyo (Kujo Kanezane's diary) it mentions that ''与二義仲一為二親眤一''木曽之定使'
It goes without saying that Yoshinaka had a say in this appointment, and in "Gyokuyo" it mentions that ''与二義仲一為二親眤一''木曽之定使'.'

sen.j: しかし強引な就任をした俊尭は比叡山の衆徒からは信望を得ることはできず、元暦元年（1184年）1月、義仲が敗死するとすぐさま比叡山を追われた。
sen.e: However after gaining the appointment in such a forceful way, Toshitaka could not gain the confidence of the priests and he was chased from Mt Hiei immediately upon the death of Yoshinaka.
However after gaining the appointment in such a forceful way, Toshitaka could not gain the confidence of the priests and he was chased from Mt Hiei immediately upon the death of Yoshinaka.

However after gaining the appointment in such a forceful way, Shungyo could not gain the confidence of the priests of Mt. Hiei and he was chased from Mt Hiei immediately upon the death of Yoshinaka in February, 1184.
sen.cmt: 年を追加しました。グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 治山一ヶ月の天台座主だった。
sen.e: He was only Chief Abbot of the Tendai Sect for one month.
He was only Chief Abbot of the Tendai Sect for one month.
He was only Tendai-zasu for one month.
sen.cmt: 天台座主 を追加しました。

sen.j: 文治2年（1186年）京都の勘解由小路京極房において入寂した。
sen.e: He died in 1186 in the house of Kyogoku Fusa of Kado-no-koji family in Kyoto.
He died in 1186 in the house of Kyogoku Fusa of Kado-no-koji family in Kyoto.
He died in 1186 in Kyogoku-bo, Kadeno-koji avenue in Kyoto.
He was 69 years old.
He was 69 years old.
